column2: >Main Working Age Benefit: Indicates whether any household member received a main working age benefit in the year ending March 2022 (from APC).

>Government Income Support and 'Other' Benefits: Quantifies the amount of government income support and 'other' benefits (e.g., Tiers 2, 3, Paid Parental Leave, Working for Families) for the year ending March 2022 (from APC).
>Low Total Household Taxable Income Indicator: Flags households with low total taxable income (from APC).
>Kāinga Ora Housing Application: Determines whether any household member applied for Kāinga Ora housing since 2020 or is a current resident.
>High Deprivation Area: Identifies whether the household is located in an area of high deprivation (NZDep2018 ≥ 8).
>Child Support Duration: Measures the proportion of time a household member was supported on benefit during childhood (up to 18 years).

column1: Health Risk Index,"
column2: color:#007c9d
>Ambulatory Sensitive Hospitalisations (ASH): Records the number of ASH incidents for adult household members over the last five years.
>Indicators of ASH Events by Type: Includes indicators for specific ASH events, i.e., respiratory-related, diabetes, strokes, cardiovascular-related, and asthma.
>Serious Mental Health Diagnosis Indicator: Indicates whether an individual aged 16 and older has received a serious mental health diagnosis based on various data sources over the past two years.
>Disability Indicator: Indicates whether households include members with a disability in the past three years.
>Residential Care History: Determines whether any household member lived in residential care during 2021.
color:#007c9d
>ASH: Records the number of ASH incidents experienced during childhood (up to 18 years old) over the last five years.
>Serious Mental Health Diagnosis Indicator: Indicates whether an individual aged under 16 has received a serious mental health diagnosis over the past two years.
>Prior Year Primary Health Organization (PHO) Enrollment: Identifies whether the child was enrolled in a PHO during the prior year.
>Health-Related School Support: Indicates whether any household member has ever received health-related support at school (e.g., High Health Needs, ORS, IRF, physical disability).

column1: Justice Risk Index,"
column2: color:#007c9d
>Victimisation: Indicates whether any household member was recorded as a victim in the police Recorded Crime Victims Statistics dataset where the offense occurred to a person in the past 10 years.
>Community Sentence Duration: Measures the proportion of time spent by a household member in the community over the past 10 years, including post-release sentences and parole.
>Custodial Sentence: Determines whether any household member spent time in custody (including prison or on remand) or home detention within the last 10 years.
color:#007c9d
>Oranga Tamariki (OT) Youth Justice Events: Records the number of OT youth justice-related events experienced during childhood (up to 18 years old).
>OT Care and Protection (CNP) Events: Records the number of OT care and protection-related events experienced during childhood (up to 18 years old).
>OT CNP Placement or CNP Custody/Guardianship: Indicates whether any household member had an OT CNP placement or spell in CNP custody/guardianship at any point.
>Qualification: Indicates whether any household member holds any qualification, serving as a proxy for literacy.
>Urban/Rural Area: Determines whether the household is situated in a rural area.
>Internet or Phone Access: Indicates whether households have access to the internet or phone services.
>Household Amenities: Indicates that the household lacks access to any of the amenities listed in the 2018 Census.
>Employment: Flags households where no one is employed or engaged in education.
>Caregiver for Disabled or Ill Individuals: Indicates that someone in the household is caring for disabled or ill family members.
>Household Composition (1): Identifies households with only one resident (single-person households).
>Household Composition (2): Identifies households where a single adult is responsible for caring for children.
>Age Composition (1): Flags households where only older individuals (aged 65 or older) reside.
>Age Composition (2): Identifies households containing at least one person aged 65 or older.
>Truancy: Determines whether any child or youth in the household was flagged for truancy issues at school.
